01 Dec 2017

Coconut Treasure Beckham

Lovely coconut flavor! Creamy and soft!

Ingredients:

Cake Ingredients:

  • 2 eggs
  • 40 grams of low gluten flour
  • sugar 30 grams
  • 25 grams of vegetable oil (corn oil)
  • 25 grams of water (or milk)

Coconut stuffing Ingredients:

  • 70 grams of coconut flakes
  • butter 70 grams
  • 50 grams of powdered sugar
  • milk powder 20 grams
  • milk (or purified water) 25 grams.

Cooking Steps

  1. First we will make the cake batter. Separate the egg yolks and egg whites. Add the egg yolks, milk, and vegetable oil (or corn oil) to a bowl. Whip until soft peaks form.

  2. Sieved the low gluten flour into the mixture.

  3. Fold the low gluten batter into the mixture and set aside.

  4. In a separate bowl add the egg whites and sugar. Beat on high.

  5. Beat the mixture until it forms stiff peaks like shown above.

  6. Take 1/3 of the egg white mixture and add it to the egg yolk batter, fold to mix.

  7. Take another 1/3 of the egg white mixture and continue to fold the mixture. Do not over mix!

  8. Pour the batter back into egg white mixture bowl.

  9. Once again fold in the mixture until just combines. The cake batter is now done. Avoid mixing for too long as this causes the mixture to lose its air bubbles, making it denser.

  10. Pour the batter into a decorating bag, and pipe the mixture onto a pan lined with parchment paper. Make sure there is sufficient space between each cake so they do not touch.

  11. Tap the pan against the counter lightly to flatten the cakes.

  12. Place the cakes into a preheated oven set to 190 â„ƒ, bake for 8-9 minutes, or until the surface is golden yellow.

  13. Set the cakes aside to cool.

  14. Next we will make the coconut stuffing. Take the soften butter and cut it into small pieces, mix in powdered sugar until the mixture has a fluffy consistency and a lighter color. Then add the milk gradually and whisk evenly.

  15. Add the coconut, and milk powder into the mixture (you can toast the coconut to make the flavor richer, but make sure the coconut flakes are cooled before adding).

  16. Mix well and the coconut stuffing is complete.

  17. Take a piece of cake and evenly coated with a layer of coconut stuffing.

  18. Fold the cake piece and make it into a taco shape.

  19. Take a knife and smooth out the exposed coconut filling.

  20. Dip the exposed portion of the coconut stuffing into a plate of coconut flakes so that the surface is covered in a layer of coconut. It is now ready to serve!
